articles.description: England's hopes of emulating 2019's shock win were dashed by errors and their enduring habit of fading out of second halves.
articles.title: Ireland 27-22 England: Steve Borthwick plan crumbles in Dublin

articles.description: Austria international Kevin Danso looked set to join Wolves but has chosen to move to Tottenham instead.
articles.title: Tottenham transfer news: Spurs beat Wolves to sign Lens defender Kevin Danso

articles.description: Liverpool are nine points clear in the Premier League and cleared their latest hurdle with a battling win over an impressive Bournemouth side.
articles.title: Liverpool pass 'tough challenge' with flying colours

articles.description: BBC Scotland assess how Huw Jones' try-scoring ability made the difference for Gregor Townsend's side in their Six Nations opener.
articles.title: Six Nations 2025: Huw Jones makes the difference for Scotland against Italy

articles.description: LeBron James inspired the Los Angeles Lakers to a 128-112 win over the New York Knicks amid reports Dallas Mavericks star Luka Doncic could soon become his new team-mate in a huge three-way trade deal.
articles.title: NBA: LeBron James stars for Los Angeles Lakers amid Luka Doncic trade reports

articles.description: England's 16-0 defeat in the Women's Ashes cannot be swept under the carpet, writes Ffion Wynne.
articles.title: Women's Ashes 2025: Losing 16-0 has to be seen as a good thing for England, and here is why

articles.description: Newcastle United contact police after midfielder Joe Willock receives "appalling" racist abuse on social media.
articles.title: Joe Willock: Newcastle report racist social media abuse sent to midfielder to police

articles.description: Arsenal welcome Manchester City to Emirates Stadium on Sunday in the sides' first meeting since their dramatic 2-2 draw in September.
articles.title: Arsenal v Man City: Rivals face each for first time since Erling Haaland's 'stay humble' comment

articles.description: Rory McIlroy and Shane Lowry are one shot behind leader Sepp Straka going into Sunday's final round of the Pebble Beach Pro-Am in California.
articles.title: Pebble Beach Pro-Am: Rory McIlroy & Shane Lowry a shot behind leader Sepp Straka

articles.description: West Ham boss Graham Potter says getting sacked by Chelsea was "maybe the best thing that happened to me".
articles.title: Chelsea v West Ham: Hammers boss Graham Potter has no ill feeling after Blues sack
